results.title: Global Oxidative Status Is Linked to Calcific Aortic Stenosis: The Differences Due to Diabetes Mellitus and the Effects of Metformin
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ can inhibit oxidative stress, yet its effects have not been studied in the context of @<m>DISEASE_109730</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:109730 @@@CAS@@@.

results.title: Metformin alleviates the calcification of aortic valve interstitial cells through activating the PI3K/AKT pathway in an AMPK dependent way
results.text_hl: However, few basic and clinical studies reported the role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_109730</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:109730 @@@CAVD@@@.

results.title: Metformin ameliorates TGF-beta1-induced osteoblastic differentiation of human aortic valve interstitial cells by inhibiting beta-catenin signaling.
results.text_hl: In conclusion, our results suggest a beneficial effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ based on the prevention of osteoblastic differentiation of @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ AVICs via inhibition of @GENE_CTNNB1 @GENE_1499 @@@beta-catenin@@@, which indicates the therapeutic potential of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ for @<m>DISEASE_109730</m> @DISEASE_OMIM:109730 @@@CAVD@@@.
